website_summaries.verdict: With up to 250x magnification, this best-selling digital microscope is perfect for anyone interested in expanding their world, from student to science buff.
pros: just plug and play into a laptop, desktop, or any system that uses standard webcam software
Brightness is adjustable with built-in LED lighting
Comes with observation pad that has measurement markings
Allows user to take video and photos with a quick button press
cons: May not always display true color of item

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for Marijuana Trichome Analysis
customer_reviews.text: This digital microscope is quite impressive for it's price point. I use it for inspecting marijuana trichomes near the end of harvest to ensure my plants are in the most optimal window for harvest. I love the fact that this product has a rear push-button that instantly takes screen shots. It's how I took these photos. I highly recommend this product. It's also really fun looking at clothing fabric and other random small things with great detail.
customer_reviews.author: Stephen

customer_reviews.title: Hard and impossible to adjust
customer_reviews.text: This is the biggest pain in the a** with trying to use this. It will change the color of the item I am trying to look at, for example, when trying to look at a bronze colored penny it looks silver on the computer screen. And adjusting is beyond frustrating. Within 5 minutes of trying to use it, Im wanting to scream. I just wish it worked :(
customer_reviews.author: ASH®

customer_reviews.title: Two things I learned a) this thing can really do a nice job. b) you can actually fix really bad ...
customer_reviews.text: I bought this specifically to use to repair scratched LPs. I have a gouged record and I wanted to see what the limits to repairing albums would be.Two things I learned a) this thing can really do a nice job. b) you can actually fix really bad scratches and have the album playable again. The first picture is of a nail clipper file. The second pic is the album scatch at a distant focus. The third pic is the high focus at the surface of the clear bezel.
customer_reviews.author: BartmanS4

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: Useless junk. Sorry I wasted my money on this. The base of the goose neck doesn't stay connected to the platform supplied without falling over every two minutes, the field of view is not adjustable, the instructions provided with the device are useless. Must I go on? Update... now weeks later after my Windows 10 update, I can't even get the PC to recognize the unit. Avoid this product at all costs. It is a total waste of money.
customer_reviews.author: Muzyck Man

customer_reviews.title: Very disappointed
customer_reviews.text: I bought this as a gift for my father for his hobbies. When he attempted to use it it wouldn't work. When he contacted the company for help, their best solution was for him to check security settings and to give them access to his computer. Something that shouldn't be required to fix an apparently defective device.
customer_reviews.author: Kristy Mecum

customer_reviews.title: Defective? Or simply doesn't work on a MacBook Pro
customer_reviews.text: Tried this on two separate MacBook Pros and could not get it to work. I'm pretty tech savvy and this isn't a complicated device and yet still couldn't get it work. Disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: J. Sheehan

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely Amazing - Even for Coins
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for photographing my coins. Take a look at these photos. The first two photos show a coin, and the third shows a high-resolution detail of a small black spot that I thought was a speck but turned out to be a mint mark next to the "D" of "DOLLAR" AWESOME PRODUCT and superb customer support. Installation was very easy, and the website had high quality videos on everything you need to know about using this product and downloading/updating/running the excellent software. The fourth attachment shows the easy-to-use software interface for taking single shots, timed shots, and movies, in a range of resolutions.
customer_reviews.author: mattgb1

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't work on two Windows 10 machines.
customer_reviews.text: Doesn't work. I tried it on a ThinkPad P50 and a Surface Laptop. On both it says "Unknown USB Device (Device Descriptor Request Failed)". Either I got a defective device or it just doesn't work on Windows 10. Terribly disappointed in this product.
customer_reviews.author: Rom

customer_reviews.title: SMD soldering/welding & rework
customer_reviews.text: UPDATE: 09.19.2017 UP ONE MORE STAR. I "fixed" the flex issue. -see pictures- purchase list- 1. 2. -6AN female 1/4" fitting 3. 1/4-20 cap screw; long enough to pass through fitting to the scope mount 4. Super Glue ORIGINAL: My use is in SMD soldering/welding & circuitboard rework + placement of SMD components - Scope works OK, but the Windows software is "wavy/jittery" compared to the OEM software download, which gives a more stable image. The "Flexible Arm" will NOT stay in a fixed position, it wanders, requiring the user to reposition the "Flexible Arm" a lot. I have tried taping it to a desktop magnifying lamp, but that only helps a little. I will find a better solution.
customer_reviews.author: James B Gatsby

customer_reviews.title: Great little microscope camera
customer_reviews.text: I used this to get close-ups of plants and flowers. It works excellent for my needs! The setup was exceptionally easy on Windows 10, just plug-n-play (plug in microscope to computer, open camera app on computer, select microscope as camera input, profit). The quality of the pictures is good enough that I can make out details that I wouldn't be able to with a standard magnifying glass. The only downside is the suction cup sometimes comes off due to the weight of the microscope, but if you clean the surface before applying the suction cup it helps it stay in place. Overall I love my new microscope!
customer_reviews.author: Well Put

customer_reviews.title: I love the functionality of it
customer_reviews.text: I bought this as a cheap quick alternative to examine Hop leaves for spider mites. I love the functionality of it, BUT the resolution is not very good. Even with it zoomed all the way out I am still unable to clearly count spider mites on the bottoms of leaves. But i guess that makes sense, the price would be more if it actually had a decent camera/resolution. I will continue to toy with it and update my review if the resolution improves.
customer_reviews.author: Nicole

customer_reviews.title: Linux + Plugable's microscope + knife blades = Excellent!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this microscope in hopes that it would give me a clear image of knife bevels and grind marks. It more than did this. Images are crystal clear, and focusing was quite simple. Attached are some test shots from a brand new Buck 692 and a Buck 110, both completely untouched by me. I am using it via a Linux system, and it works flawlessly. It's simply a plug and play setup. Plug it in, fire up the software and get to work....nice!!
customer_reviews.author: Danny

customer_reviews.title: Not a toy - useful tool
customer_reviews.text: I bought it with the intention of using it to aid in the sharpening of tools and knives. It works perfectly for this and gives a very useable image to work from. The stand and holder are nicer than I expected but would be more useful to those that use the microscope to view flat objects or documents. The zoom ranges are very appropriate for viewing common objects. I'm plenty happy with it as-is, but If it had 5MP or greater resolution, I'd be even more impressed.
customer_reviews.author: A. C.

customer_reviews.title: You have to use third party software and it's horrible. The stand is kind of pointless as you ...
customer_reviews.text: don't buy if you plan on using it with android it worked barely disconnecting every 10 seconds and now wont connect at all after trying it for 5 minutes. You have to use third party software and it's horrible. The stand is kind of pointless as you have to basically put the scope right on top of what you want to look at. should have bought the 20 dollar one at least I wouldnt have wasted money on this.
customer_reviews.author: franks

customer_reviews.title: Not 250x
customer_reviews.text: This might be 30x, but it is not even close to 250x. There is no zoom; you adjust the resolution from the Settings window. Focus adjustment a bit stiff meaning the camera moves on its flexible stalk, pointing somewhere new. Nicely packaged, but hard to focus.
customer_reviews.author: Clayton E. Cramer

customer_reviews.title: Great Microcope
customer_reviews.text: This is the second one I got I bought a cheaper model and it the software crashed all the time. This one that was recommended by Robfindstreasure works great. It never crashes and very easy to use. I use it for my YouTube channel TemporalCoins. If I were to have anything bad about would be that the only way to zoom is to change the focal length. For those that don't know what that means is that you have to bring the object closer to the lens and refocus instead of it just zooming in with a button. It's still a great microscope.
customer_reviews.author: Robert

customer_reviews.title: Just Buy It! It's a very handy and well made little device!
customer_reviews.text: I love this little camera. I have it installed on my 27" iMac running 10.13.6 , and the resolution is good on full screen (I did get a message when I installed the software saying all features may not be compatible with this version of software, but all seems to work fine) I plan on using it to help sharpen my metal cutting lathe tool bits. I have a large optical comparator, but this is much handier.... and takes up very little space, plus I can use it to help remove all the little metal splinters I get in my hands that I can never see.
customer_reviews.author: Another Old Guy

customer_reviews.title: got a blank screen. written to the folks. wait and see i guess.
customer_reviews.text: cant get mine to work. with through the process. downloaded the program . opened it up and i have a black screen. nothing. doesnt make sence really. I have written to these folks to see if they can help me before i send it back. i would really like them to fix it. hell maybe thiers something wrong with my dell? If they can get me up and running i think i should return on here and change my stars , if thats possible.
customer_reviews.author: Mark Liberatore

customer_reviews.title: Whaaaaat? This thing for 40 bucks! Wow!!
customer_reviews.text: Anyone who writes a review SHOULD temper everything they say against what they paid (or didn't pay). We're talking $40 people! I bought it because I want to document rock chip repairs on windscreens. I'm tired of using my phone. That's my purpose. So unboxing was fine, the suction cup gooseneck is solid! Neck made of metal. The camera itself feels fine, the focus collar ring felt smooth, almost lubricated. I bought a USB adapter to 'C', so I plug it straight into my LG V30 android phone. So capture controls are on the phone. 'CameraFi' downloaded from the app store. For me I couldn't be more pleased.
customer_reviews.author: Dennis L C

customer_reviews.title: Meh
customer_reviews.text: Plugable USB Digital Microscope 250x Magnification - 2.0 Megapixels, Includes LED Light and Webcam Chipset, C t's ok. Better than nothing I guess. Biggest problem? The suction cup DOES NOT WORK. I'll be sitting there after I spent 5 minutes trying to focus it, and the dam thing just falls over. Put it back up, refocus it and it does the same thing. If youre expecting to be able to sit this 1 foot away from an object and zoom in, think again. 6 inches is probably the furthest it can be. Don't use Acetone or MEK near the plastic piece or it will melt it.
customer_reviews.author: PowerUser

customer_reviews.title: shakey
customer_reviews.text: While it is affordable, it is not very stable. The flexible arm is hard to adjust, and when trying to focus moves around. It is very hard for me to focus the unit on small items such as turntable cartridges - stylus. tends to come off the base often as well there were also some software issues, after being installed it sometimes swapped device names with other USB devices. I could get it to work by selecting the mistaken device and it would work. Overall, not too bad for the money and gave me a reference on what to look for in the future as far as design and optics, and at a reasonable cost.
customer_reviews.author: Delia o.

customer_reviews.title: It takes great photos, image is reversed like many microscopes.
customer_reviews.text: The holder is not very good. The holder design could be vastly improved. The reversed image is irritating. This will be difficult to use to solder parts on a circuit board but can be done. It can be corrected by having another lens in the optics chain but my suspicion is the manufacturer was going for least cost. These are the things the manufacturer could point out, of course pointing out the alternate better unit at the same time. If you want to take pictures of defects or broken parts or bugs or stamens and bacteria this is ok. It is definitely not great.
customer_reviews.author: D. Patelzick

customer_reviews.title: Worth having in your electronics lab!
customer_reviews.text: Easy to setup and use. I needed it to check my smd solder work and check part number on small ICs. It met my expectations on that end. Quality of the picture is very nice and clear. Zooming is great for the price. Lighting needs some improvement since it doesn't disperse very much at close distance which blurs the picture if what you are observing is slightly shiny or metallic , in my case I had to keep adjusting the angle and lighting intensity to inspect solder pads but works great with inspecting part numbers on the small ICs.
customer_reviews.author: nersa

customer_reviews.title: Fabulous item
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this mostly to use with our grandson, but Gramps and I were just as -- maybe more than? - entertained as he was. Science fun at a very reasonable price. It will very likely come in handy for art, as well. I have good school-quality microscopes, but this is much easier to use (and I do understand that the end results aren't the same).
customer_reviews.author: pkf

customer_reviews.title: Works with any computer
customer_reviews.text: I recently got back into coin collecting and needed a decent magnifying glass to see the dates and mint marks on the various coins. This microscope exceeded my expectations. I would recommend it to anyone needing a good microscope to magnify anything they look at. Wish I could have had it when I still worked as a mechanic to get the tiny pieces of metal in my fingers out.
customer_reviews.author: Charles F. Hall

customer_reviews.title: Third Time Is the Charm!
customer_reviews.text: I ordered one and it was dead on arrival. I requested a replacement and received the replacement. The replacement came and I tried it, and it turned out that the USB cable was very unreliable. The manufacturer encouraged me to get it replaced again, and on the third try, I finally got one that works!
customer_reviews.author: DB

customer_reviews.title: Plugable  USB Scope
customer_reviews.text: I am going to use this scope primarily for looking at coin collection. Downloaded the updated drivers and have worked with it, amazing little scope and perfectly clear image on mounting board. Takes a bit of orientation coordination but that will come with time. I would buy it again and recommend it to others. Tried it on my tablet but it wouldn't work, yet. Suggested app for android doesn't get good reviews so I'll pass on that. Will try others. Have it installed on Win 7 desktop. Will try it on XP and Win 10 machines.
customer_reviews.author: Douglas G. Holland

customer_reviews.title: A great little item
customer_reviews.text: I used it to get close-up of coins, most of the takes good pictures and the zoom quality seems to be good. Easy to use, a person just has to get use to angeling the coin to get the proper picture. Once you get use to it, it works good. Only drawback is the button at the top, for taking pictures is very sensitive. You can end up with more pictures than you need. Not really a big problem
customer_reviews.author: roy

customer_reviews.title: The microscope works pretty well, I just think the stand is cheesy
customer_reviews.text: The microscope works pretty well, I just think the stand is cheesy. Wish it had a plastic base similar to a traditional microscope instead of the flex arm with the suction cup. When your focal field is only a fraction of a millimeter in depth, the tiniest bit of vibration or flex in that arm ruins the process. Trying to adjust the focus on a flex arm is nearly impossible without shaking the microscope mount.
customer_reviews.author: Benjamin Russo

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: This little camera worked great for me. I bought it to install an HDMI mod to my Nintendo 64. I soldered the flex cable to the board and used the camera to inspect my work to make sure I didn't have any bridges. It is plug and play with a Chromebook. Simply plug it in and open the camera app. I also used it with a Pixel 2 Android phone. I used the "Camerafi" app and another app called "USB Camera - Connect EasyCap or USB Webcam". Both apps worked but the second had a lot more features and customization. Because of how easy it is to use it with my Chromebook I decided to use that in the end.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew

customer_reviews.title: Does what it is designed for
customer_reviews.text: Good, acceptable quality; much better than much more expensive USB Digital Microscopes in the market. Should learn to adjust settings, angle of objects, lighting to get best picture quality and magnification. See the effect of different external lighting (5000K-3000K) and light reflection on native metal specimen from different angles in images/video posted (Lights of the microscope switched off to prevent reflection on shiny metal specimen).
customer_reviews.author: AK

customer_reviews.title: It's like a sore peter... you just can't beat it!  Great value - Android friendly
customer_reviews.text: Well worth the $34.95 I spent on it; great detail and magnification. This digital microscope works on Windows 7 Pro (64bit), Windows 10 Pro (64bit) on my Samsung S6 Edge+ smartphone (with USB adapter). I personally like using the smartphone app "CameraFi" that the Plugable company website recommends better than using the Windows software. It is fun for the entire family and is well built... yes it is plastic but the design makes it durable enough that you don't need to baby it. The integrated LED lighting is a nice touch and aids in capturing the tiniest details. Magnification is controlled by how far the lens is away from the object you're viewing in combination of the focus ring.
customer_reviews.author: Sam Fisher

customer_reviews.title: Super inexpensive but super handy
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my desk to zoom in on small pieces and document them. Plug it into a USB port and download the app tat simple. Spent a little time playing with the app, fairly simple app with not a lot of function. Take picture or video and save to a file/folder. Picture quality is good and the zoom looks to be about 10X. Adjustable arm is stable but sometimes maybe a little too stiff. Can be a pain to adjust for goofy angled shots would've liked a 3D locking articulating arm over the cheapy flex-o-arm thing. Suction cup attachment is strong and hasn't come undone yet.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Hands down an incredible buy and great value
customer_reviews.text: You won't be disappointed! We didn't want to spend a lot of money on a digital microscope and we had zero experience with them. This was a GREAT purchase and the zoom quality is great. You can also take still pictures by touching the top of the microscope. The only downfall is that occasionally to have to remount this because the suction cup comes loose, but that is only when you are cranking on the microscope. LOVE this product and it connects instantly to your USB.
customer_reviews.author: El Conquistador

customer_reviews.title: Can't beat it for the price, but strings attached
customer_reviews.text: Works great, though it took a few minutes to realize that the grey band around the barrel is actually for focusing it. I got an email right after buying it with the link to the software. It only took a minute or so to download, and it was easy to install. The only complaint I have is all the other applications that come with it that have nothing to do with it. I realized I suddenly had all these new apps that I had to track down and uninstall. I do not believe any of them were actually malware, but nothing should ever be installed without prior approval. So back to the microscope, I love it!
customer_reviews.author: Frontman1955

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Prime Day Deal
customer_reviews.text: I got this on discount for Prime Day. For $25ish it was definitely a good value for the money. For curious children who wish to see what everyday objects look like "close up" this is an awesome educational tool. It works with any computer, but if you want to use it with an Android device you'll need a USB "on the go" (OTG) adapter. I got a pair of those for $7 It won't work with iPhones, iPads or any other iOS device.
customer_reviews.author: Phil

customer_reviews.title: Thoroughly satisfying
customer_reviews.text: After seeing the more expensive prices for cameras of this type, I wasn't expecting a lot from this one. But based on other reviews (many saying the same thing), I gave this one a shot. As noted in the headline, it's thoroughly satisfying. The build quality is really nice. Feels solid. Even the goose neck attachment is good looking and well made. Most importantly, the image quality is excellent. I tried it on my skin. Now I know what must have inspired many a sci-fi movie.
customer_reviews.author: Alan M.

customer_reviews.title: Not much better than the first one I bought
customer_reviews.text: The camera is pretty much the same quality of manufacture and picture quality as the first one I bought a couple years ago but it is worth the money. I've not had the need for the suction cup attachment to the thin base but they are equivalent quality to the camera. The software is still pretty basic and the video capability is good but not exceptional. I'd recommend this to those looking for a simple USB microscope with limited needs for zoom and picture quality.
customer_reviews.author: F. Waidelich

customer_reviews.title: The magnifier you didn't know you wanted and needed
customer_reviews.text: This is one of the most enjoyable and useful pieces of technology you'll ever own! It's very simple to set up and operate. In fact the hardest thing about it is putting it away, there's always one more thing you want to look at. I've used it to look at small print,finding how to open small devices, seeing what's not working in a mechanism, and finding lost parts. But more than anything, I just look at things. It's amazing how everyday things look like when highly magnified (like your fingernail even right after a manicure, yuk). to be fair, this isn't a high-powered microscope, but almost anyone could put this to good use and it's very affordable.
customer_reviews.author: Darrell Poteet

customer_reviews.title: I think it's as good as other brands that cost over 3 times as ...
customer_reviews.text: Just got it today and started playing with it. Downloaded the Digital Viewer from the Plugable website and started using it right away. Experimented with several objects including some very tiny fossil samples. I'm really impressed with the quality of images, ease of use and the functionality of it. For the price, I think it's as good as other brands that cost over 3 times as much. I'm super please with it and is very intuitive to use along with great quality of images.
customer_reviews.author: Farmer John

customer_reviews.title: + Price, - Everything Else
customer_reviews.text: Although the price was fantastic, it was definitely to distract you from or lessen the blow from the inferior quality. Though all the pieces are there and it does function, I can't escape the feeling that the microscope just seems unfinished. The software (which isn't included) must be downloaded and installed and then with no instructions, you are left to your own devices thereafter. At first I thought mine was faulty or broken. After some time messing with the zoom and distance from the lenses, I stumbled upon the perfect combination that made the image jump to life on my screen although, the image movement lags on screen.
customer_reviews.author: Cathy Lane

customer_reviews.title: It portable
customer_reviews.text: I have been collecting coins for years and I've looked for something that would bring them in close, so you can see if there are any mint errors and overall look at the coins and bills. This Digital microscope is just the thing I've been looking for. It's small yet it bring what ever you are looking at in real close, just plug into your computer and start looking. It is a great little tool for any time you need to see in close. It works great!
customer_reviews.author: RC

customer_reviews.title: Good low cost scope
customer_reviews.text: I’m a coin collector and coin grading is everything. As soon as I received this scope I set it up (very easy) and set about looking over some coins I’d acquired recently. To the naked eye many appeared to be in an AU to low MS grade, but after placing them under the scope for magnification the flaws really showed up and I was able to properly grade them before placing them in my collection. Focus is a bit touchy but once I got the imaging is very clear. Photo quality is good too. This is a good low cost magnifier for the job and I will recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Ken Tanguis

customer_reviews.title: Surprisingly high quality for the price
customer_reviews.text: Good materials, good image quality, feels like it will last. This is not the cheapest option available, but I feel it's the cheapest "good" option, and you'd have to pay several times as much to get anything better. In particular, I'm impressed with image quality across the entire field. I thought that given the low price it'd be only sharp in the center, but the imaging field is flat enough to render corners acceptably as well. Very satisfied with the purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Some Dude

customer_reviews.title: Better than Jiusion 40 to 1000x IMO
customer_reviews.text: I like this one much better than "Jiusion 40 to 1000x Magnification Endoscope". Not exactly comparing apples to apples but you can check out my review on that item if you were wondering which one to get. This camera has plenty of working distance and I like adjusting the focus better than adjusting the distance from the part like the other camera. The plate the camera comes with the camera is simple but functional and the flexible arm is easy to move yet surprisingly sturdy. The frame rate seems better suited for working i.e. not as much lag and higher frame rate.
customer_reviews.author: D. Garner

customer_reviews.title: Great little camera with user easy to use software.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to take photos of coins. The camera is amazing and the software is super easy to use. (I am using windows 10 1709 build.) The soft button on the back was a little concerning to me as I have tremors and I was concerned that touching the button would cause me to lose focus, but the software includes a "button" for capture using your mouse and it is not necessary to touch the camera once it is focused. The camera arrived in one day and I got an email from the seller before the camera arrived with download links for the software. Definitely would recommend this camera.
customer_reviews.author: Gator Guy

customer_reviews.title: It works, but it is wrongly specified
customer_reviews.text: The camera worked right out of the box. It enlarges. It's got light and focus, which is a lot. It feels well made. However, it doesn't feel like x250 magnification. At a distance of 1 or 2 inches, it feels more like x10 magnification. In VGA mode (640x480) it has acceptable response time. At higher resolutions there is significant movement smearing i.e. large latency. It updates slowly. Image quality is not so good in high resolution. For the price it's a good product.
customer_reviews.author: Oded

customer_reviews.title: Meh
customer_reviews.text: It's good for the kids to play with. Don't expect much. The camera is a fixed zoom, and has a very shallow depth of field and very mediocre optics. The connection to the PC is super slow at high resolution. There is an obnoxious picture taking button on its back that you have to touch to take a photo - thus shake the camera. This is definitely a kids toy and nothing an adult would find useful or satisfying.
customer_reviews.author: Mick Pen

customer_reviews.title: An inexpensive, easy to use basic digital microscope.
customer_reviews.text: This isn't a high-powered microscope by any means, but it gives a similar view as if looking through a jeweler's loop. The setup is fairly straightforward given it's a Plugable device - I paired it with a Chromebook easily. The latency is noticeable &, as a present for my 4 yr old daughter to look up close at flowers and leaves she finds, it initially tried her patience. But she has learned how it works & now finds all sorts of things to get a closer look at.
customer_reviews.author: Joshua Jordan

customer_reviews.title: You get what you pay for
customer_reviews.text: If you are seriously wanting a reliable digital microscope look further. Item is flimsy, hard to adjust, hard to keep on its stand and was for me impossible to get "married" to windows 10, with which it is supposed to be compatible and easy, so I could never see a digital image on my screen. The product is unsteady on its flimsy mounting, and the suction cup was not reliable in holding the scope to my desk when I tried to adjust the arm.
customer_reviews.author: rmcg.

customer_reviews.title: Great resolution
customer_reviews.text: Wow! Far exceeded my expectations. The focus is very sensitive but becomes quite sharp. The software I installed for OSX (Mac) is simple but very good. When you launch the software it turns the unit on automatically. It has buttons for still or video. I suggest going into settings and defining where you want the photos and videos stored. I only have one complaint: the goose neck needs to be longer. As it is, i cannot get it high enough to get all of a quarter into the frame. It barely fits a penny. I will have to come up with a block to raise the suction cup higher.
customer_reviews.author: Allen

customer_reviews.title: Plugable Technologies has knocked it outta the park.
customer_reviews.text: This is an amazing little scope. It was clear from the first that Plugable Technologies cares about their product. Days before receiving the scope I got an email from them giving explicit directions for downloading the software and successfully using the digital microscope. I loaded the software on my pic and everything went as advertised. I then attached the scope to the side of my inspection microscope and ran the USB through my Raspberry Pi. It has found a home on my workbench. Buy this scope. It works as advertised and it is a quality product.
customer_reviews.author: A. Koenig

customer_reviews.title: Wow.
customer_reviews.text: This is an amazing micrcoscope for the cost. I've purchased a few low-cost microscopes and discarded them because and they've all been crap until this. This isn't in the league of the $10-15k microscopes I've used in lab, but if you just want to check out a bug you grabbed in the yard this is what you want. You need to focus by hand, which is tricky at higher magnifications. And, there's no easy way of knowing what magnification its on. Still, it's a home microscope so I'm not letting those things influence my rating. If I broke this, I would buy another.
customer_reviews.author: S. ODonnell

customer_reviews.title: Better than more expensive brands!  Great values.
customer_reviews.text: Found video comparing to an expensive version. This was found to be better. Quality is great! Easy to use - but had to download driver. Address provided in instructions. Very happy with price and quality. Very sturdy - excellent value & product.
customer_reviews.author: CC

customer_reviews.title: Better than expected and works well with Linux
customer_reviews.text: I'm using Linux. I had trouble trying to use VLC with this unit, but after downloading Cheese, everything seems to work quite well. At first I was using the unit too far away from the subject, and the magnification was unimpressive, so I looked at the Pluggable website. They mention that you'll get the highest magnification by placing the unit as close as possible to the subject. The pictures I took are of a knife edge, and a dime. When I got really close to the dime, all you can see is the 17 in 2017. I would expect it to work equally well on Windows, but I haven't tried it yet.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. Smith

customer_reviews.title: Probably the best value in a wide price range.
customer_reviews.text: Goid for coin inspection. You can not zoom in. You push the microscope closer to the object and use focus dial. The picture is limited to what you computer offers. I have a cheap crome book and it is fine. I did not need a driver, it was plug and play but features and function may be different. I can not take a picture with the button on scope but it does wprk with the icon on screen.
customer_reviews.author: mpan

customer_reviews.title: Returned this item. To the manufacturer, "zoom" means ...
customer_reviews.text: Returned this item to the manufacturer, "zoom" means to physically push the camera closer to the subject. Also, the data from the camera to the computer is slow causing a several second lag between what you see in live view and what is actually happening in front of the camera.
customer_reviews.author: Picky tech guy

customer_reviews.title: Definitely NOT plug and play, waste of time and money
customer_reviews.text: Downloaded the required drivers and software and wasted 3 hrs of my time trying to make it work. Tried it on my laptop and PC. (Both high end computers running windows 10), camera would not power up on either unit. After reading the negative comments I see this is a common problem. Tried the suggested fixes to no avail. I do NOT recommend this USB camera. Save your time and frustration and buy something different.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Issues with this device.
customer_reviews.text: Horrible driver support or lack there of for this device. Exact same issue on three different laptops running both Windows 7 and Windows 10. This device would simply stop working and you would need to unplug everything and then reset the software. This was a step that had to be repeated continually, sometimes it is an for only a few seconds, then after resetting everything it may run for five minutes before blowing up.
customer_reviews.author: J. Graves

customer_reviews.title: While it worked it was awesome
customer_reviews.text: Worked well the first two times we used it, I can no longer get it to turn on. Uninstalled and reinstalled the software 2 different occasions, went to the pluggable site and ran the debugging software, it helped on one occasion but didn't after that initial time. Sending it back. It is a shame because while it worked it was incredible, really impressive picture quality, and the software is easy to use. Not sure what to try next as my son was really enjoying this one.
customer_reviews.author: Randy Morrow

customer_reviews.title: Very nice for the price!
customer_reviews.text: -Great image (Print on diode in image not discernable with naked eye.) -Clean focus -Bright dimmable light -Sturdy articulating mount arm -Strong suction cup on base -Works with Pixel 3XL (Android 10)
customer_reviews.author: Leonard Washington

customer_reviews.title: Weaksauce drivers & promises
customer_reviews.text: Product description promises that this product works with Chrome OS. Set-Up directions (online) are out-dated, driver recommended doesn't exist in Android store. Long story short- i used the wife's Window Surface tablet and found a driver to make this product come to life. It works well, after 3 hours of setting up... But can't help but think a different brand would have a better set up. Buy at your own risk.
customer_reviews.author: nibbyquilter

customer_reviews.title: Excellent microscope for the price
customer_reviews.text: Bought this on Prime Day for my kids, and it's an excellent microscope for the prices. Attached are some examples: the blade stamp on a Swiss Army knife, closeup of a quarter, the circuit board of a Raspberry Pi Zero W. The cons are that the relatively low-resolution sensor is somewhat noisy, and precise focus is difficult with the included flexible stand. I just ordered a geared metal stand () that I'll review separately when it arrives.
customer_reviews.author: Asher

customer_reviews.title: Surprisingly great. For the price, awesome.
customer_reviews.text: I confess that I did not expect the quality of this USB digital microphone to be as good as it is. I am really into coffee, so the first thing I did is put one of the beans that I roasted underneath the lens. It showed me full magnification, incredibly sharp! The LED lights lit it up perfectly, there is no noise in the image. This is a real USB microscope for very little money. Easy to use. I'm very pleased and the software is good to.
customer_reviews.author: Mark H.

customer_reviews.title: Great microscope. Works out of the box with no ...
customer_reviews.text: Great microscope. Works out of the box with no drivers on Windows 10, Fedora 24, and Android 7 (on both Pixel C and Nexus 6, with the CameraFi app, via this cable:  ). Would probably work on other Android phones that have a micro-USB cable with a USB OTG adapter, but it depends on the phone and Android version.
customer_reviews.author: Luke

customer_reviews.title: Excellent customer service!
customer_reviews.text: After about 4 months, the lights started to go. They usually worked but occasionally one would not come on. After 6 months, it stopped working all together. Disappointing. Edited... I am changing my review after receiving an unsolicited email from Plugable Technologies apologizing and offering to replace the microscope. I was stunned - you don't see that kind of customer service very often in this day and age! The new microscope they sent is slightly different with much brighter lights. I look forward to using it for a nice long time and will try to remember to update again in 6 months.
customer_reviews.author: Tana

customer_reviews.title: No Zoom Feature, Works Well for the Money
customer_reviews.text: You get exactly what you pay for. It magnifies very well and is good for hobbyist and that's it it does not have a zoom feature it has a one Focus feature that's it the lighting is sub par I use it for looking at coins I would recommend a better camera magnifier. This would be something I would have no problem giving to children to magnify things and enlarged the world for them essentially if your break it is not a big deal but on that note it does what it says it's supposed to do so I'm fairly happy with it.
customer_reviews.author: sbagwell

customer_reviews.title: Not for slides, but okay for bigger items.
customer_reviews.text: This is not so much a microscope as it is a zoom lens. Though we enjoyed studying our skin, some coins, dog food, and event a tomato, the slides we tried to look at were all blurry no matter how hard we tried. We moved the scope, move the slide, zoomed in, zoomed out, all blur. We are going to send it back and get an actual microscope to work with slides. If you want to explore larger objects (bugs?), I think this is a great microscope for the price, it's just not for us.
customer_reviews.author: **Top Secret**

customer_reviews.title: Light tends to fail quickly.
customer_reviews.text: The light had to be repaired (by me) because it no longer would work after about a month. Aside from that, all works fine. The problem with the light is the contacts inside the dimmer wheel are very cheap and weak, and do not make good contact. A little plastic washer applying pressure fixed it right up, something that better tolerances in the product could have prevented.
customer_reviews.author: Jamie Goodwin

customer_reviews.title: OK but ...
customer_reviews.text: Lots of trouble getting recommended software to grab the camera as it wanted to use the integrated laptop camera. Driver reported installed properly. Turns out I had to select stop selecting the correct camera in the app to get it to work. Who knew? Recommend software swaps the two camera identifications. Once I allowed the app to select the integrated camera instead of manually selecting the correct camera it worked. Camera has no zoom. To zoom, move the camera closer and refocus. Makes it difficult to use if zoom is desired as holder is limited in motion control.
customer_reviews.author: GadetGuy

customer_reviews.title: Not huge magnification, but enough for many things
customer_reviews.text: As a reef keeper I am always curious as to whether i have any tiny critters working on a particular problem. With this microscope I have been able to see copepods and tiny spaghetti worms feasting on an algae patch. Warning: the camera in this device is the same as the Oculus Rift sensors, so in order to use this device you can not have the Oculus drivers installed on your system.
customer_reviews.author: W. Garrett

customer_reviews.title: Great for detecting & preventing the purchase of Fake Magic the Gathering Cards! 5 Stars!
customer_reviews.text: Love this thing! One of my favorite purchases on Amazon! Great for detecting & preventing the purchase of Fake Magic the Gathering Cards! 5 Stars! Handheld microscope referenced
customer_reviews.author: Sir Harry's - Product Video Reviews in HD. With "Baffles Me" Box Openings and Auctions for Charity. Like what you see? Please FOLLOW ME!

customer_reviews.title: Less than 5 minutes to install
customer_reviews.text: Setup and installation was EASY. I use it to inspect coins, and it is great. Excellent resolution. The software can access all cameras on your PC, and it would be great if you could set a default camera, in this case, the microscope. However, it is no big deal to open the app settings and switch camera. Well worth the cost for most needs.
customer_reviews.author: Tom Z

customer_reviews.title: Good item, some of the one star reveiws are due to user error.
customer_reviews.text: I read some reviews saying the camera would not work for more than a few seconds. I had this happen but quickly discovered why. The issue was I had it pluged it into a USB splitter. Once I plugged it direct to the computer it worked flawlessly. Hopefully this will help someone avoid the same issue. Also you will need to adjust the focus ring a lot to get the picture adjusted at first but it will work.
customer_reviews.author: SoCalAdam

customer_reviews.title: this will be a right and cheap solution for you
customer_reviews.text: Overall a good product with two suggestions. i use this for production's MRB department to capture the damage products for RMA return. this price range can have light adjustment also can adjust the focus to what you want. What else you can ask for? 1. If the flexable arm can be double or at least 50% longer will be better 2. that is notas easy as plug and play. the manual do not have clear instruction to follow that can guide you through the set up process.
customer_reviews.author: William

customer_reviews.title: not perfect but fun and interesting
customer_reviews.text: For the price this is a fun toy, but digital magnification has some serious limitations. I bought this to inspect knife edges when sharpening, but in the end I end up using my 10x optical loupe instead of this. I own 6-8 Plugable products (all USB 2.0 and 3.0 hubs) and they make great stuff. I highly recommend the company. But this USB microscope just doesn't cut it for me for anything serious. That said, with Amazon's awesome return policy I could easily return this, but it's intriguing enough than I won't. In other words, it's far from perfect but it's worth the asking price.
customer_reviews.author: RJSD

customer_reviews.title: Fix your Win 10 privacy settings to get it running.
customer_reviews.text: Just a heads up if you are attempting to run this on a Windows 10 PC with the April 2018 update. After installing the drivers and program, go into Windows settings and then privacy to allow programs access to your camera. It should work well at that point.
customer_reviews.author: BTaylor

customer_reviews.title: Mediocre microscope
customer_reviews.text: This microscope is about what one might expect for such a modest price. It relies on third-party software, has marginal optics and marginal sensor. With some fiddling, it can be quite serviceable. The integral light is a nice touch. If looking for an inspection microscope for casual use or a child's lab, this is OK.

customer_reviews.title: Good scientific toy for the kids
customer_reviews.text: My kids had one of these microscopes that look like a giant eye and plug to the TV. When it broke, I decided to pay a little bit more and get this one. It works great for the purpose of exploring everyday things. It would be a great addition to a classroom. Pros: Had no problems setting it up and getting it to work. Takes pictures Inexpensive Cons: The image is not very good. Though it is great to have a base, it is awkward to use and the camera tips over The plastic thing that holds the camera looks flimsy and I am sure it won't last long
customer_reviews.author: Gabriel G-konig

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use
customer_reviews.text: I give it 5 stars based on how easy it is to set up and use. It even works great on my android phone (using an app from the playstore). The camera is 2 megapixels, and zoom is limited by the size of your screen and the 2 MP resolution. I got it hoping to see tardigrades, but resolution appears to be insufficient for that. It is perfect for looking at things like snake skins, feathers, coins, etc.
customer_reviews.author: margie

customer_reviews.title: Great Microscope & Easy to use & Fun
customer_reviews.text: Perfect little microscope. Brings magnification to any object, especially the small one you can see. It was easy to install by following the video. I had to figure out how to get my camera to work with it but that was my computer settings not the product. Exactly what I needed and great price for what you receive. Hooked up to one of my old laptops I don’t use anymore so I have a dedicated area for using it. I’m so pleased.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great with Linux
customer_reviews.text: I really appreciate that Plugable included Linux support in their list of features. Once plugged into USB, install a viewer. I think this one is the best (Ubuntu installation): sudo add-apt-repository ppa:pj-assis/ppa sudo apt-get update sudo apt-get install guvcview Change the resolution from the default to the maximum. Note: The capacitive button doesn't take blur free photos in this configuration. It was unreliable and only worked if tapped firmly. I don't need it though because I control the device through software.
customer_reviews.author: RedSquirrel

customer_reviews.title: Exceptionally great...perfect for fiber identification.
customer_reviews.text: After a great deal of time researching these, I finally purchased this for fiber identification. It is very strong and puts the photograph right onto the computer just like it says. Then the image can be tweaked on any photoshop or camera processing program. This truly is a great inexpensive laboratory-styled microscope for home use. The picture quality for the price is excellent.
customer_reviews.author: Lydia

customer_reviews.title: Good product
customer_reviews.text: Good product. The lights are a little flaky and sometimes the color goes to just a grey scale. It does take good pictures. I've found the highest resolution to be the best. I simply have to place it far enough above my coins to give a sharp clear picture of the coin, and closer for specific places on the coin. Good price, easy interface. If you're looking for something for excellent quality photos, this isn't the one you want. The lights are unreliable. However, as my rating shows, I am overall satisfied with it.
customer_reviews.author: TJ

customer_reviews.title: It's okay if you're not too picky
customer_reviews.text: This usb microscope does work okay, I had two issues with it, number one: in order to get full 250x you have to have the clear plastic piece on the end touching or nearly touching the subject you are magnifying, the flexible arm will not keep the scope at this close distance thus you must hold it down by hand., poor choice of materials for the stand. Second: the picture quality in my opinion was not good regardless of making changes to the settings or lighting, looking at pennies under this scope actually makes it seem like you are looking at clad coins instead of copper/zinc. I give this 4 stars
customer_reviews.author: James

customer_reviews.title: Fun for exploring nature with the kids
customer_reviews.text: I've had so much fun with this with the kids. It took a little trial and error to get the best zoom (moving the camera closer and full screening the image help) you can adjust focus and lighting easily on the microscope. Discovering tiny bugs crawling around on leaves was the coolest! The app (used on my laptop) allows you to easily take single shots, videos, and timed shots.
customer_reviews.author: Amanda

customer_reviews.title: Not that great
customer_reviews.text: I guess most of the people on here have never used a microscope before because this isn't all that amazing. The resolution isn't very good, the software is third rate, and the scope itself wanders at its closest setting. Just very cheap overall. You 100% get exactly what you pay for, not a bit more.
customer_reviews.author: Bdub

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful product for close up magnification on a computer screen
customer_reviews.text: This microscope puts the image you point it at in crisp, sharp focus onto your computer screen. Very easy to set up! Up and running in less than 8 minutes out of the box! Has nifty stand with articulating arm. Use some books to elevate the scope and you can get a larger perspective. Has a suction cup base that not only works on the viewing plate, but will stick to other materials that are smooth and nonporous. For the price this is a terrific device. My eyesight is getting worse as the years go by and this helps me inspect cameras that even a magnifying glass does not help as well.
customer_reviews.author: Richard Dulkin

customer_reviews.title: Easy set up, Nice Pix
customer_reviews.text: Integrates nicely with my desktop system. I use it for coins. Gets a good shot of what I want to look at and photograph, but this camera does not ZOOM. If it does, please tell me how. If it has zoom that I don't know how to operate, then other people will have the same problem. If it zooms, then I will rerate this item.
customer_reviews.author: hope coman

customer_reviews.title: Beyond good, all the way to delightful
customer_reviews.text: Surprisingly good frame rate. Painless operation. Adjustable, built-in illumination with cool white LEDs arranged to cast no shadows. Easy, smooth focusing with crisp images. And really amazingly responsive support from Plugable! I had a question, posted it to their online forum, and had a really helpful answer within a couple hours. I now rank Plugable right up there with Anker as a preferred supplier of accessories and peripherals.
customer_reviews.author: S. Jordan

customer_reviews.title: No 250X
customer_reviews.text: I cannot get the 250 magnification they claim. they say that the magnification depends on the monitor size, what do you need a 70 inch 4K TV? It is hard to tell, but the highest magnification I can get is around 25X.
customer_reviews.author: MLK

customer_reviews.title: Almost Perfect
customer_reviews.text: I use this to photograph small flat objects, say 1/2 inch across. To get the entire sample in the field of view I place the stand on a stack of books and point the microscope down to the table where the object is . The microscope produces very sharp images. Especially useful is the time lapse still photo option, as it allows vibrations to settle down in my table. I took away one star because I don't like the gooseneck arm in the stand. It is difficult to get the camera perfectly aligned with the object; I get a little distortion. I'll look around for a better stand. Otherwise, this is perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Engineer

customer_reviews.title: Good budget camera but low quality pics, hard to zoom in, not good for examining coins.
customer_reviews.text: Not great for examining coins -- better off getting a high megapixel camera. This camera is takes low quality pictures even at 1600x1200 resolution. It is difficult to zoom in on objects. The LED lighting can reflect terribly on shiny objects even at a low light setting. You get what you pay for -- if you are on a tight budget this camera will get the job done. However, if you can spend a little more get a camera with more megapixels.
customer_reviews.author: Seth L.

customer_reviews.title: Its a budget microscope
customer_reviews.text: I think this needs a usb3 refresh. It's just good enough for what I need it for, which is casual examination of soldering on pcbs I work on. A refresh with a usb3 camera and 60fps @ 1080p would put this into a class of its own. The optics and design seem good just that low refresh rate is holding it back.
customer_reviews.author: Yan Li

customer_reviews.title: One of the better low-cost USB microscopes
customer_reviews.text: I have had several USB microscopes and this is clearly the best. Solid cabling, smoother, easy focus knob, convenient snapshot button. Bundled app turns on LED illumination when stated. No control for LED brightness or on/off. App image quality not the best. I get better resolution and quality using VideoLan capture but then LED can't be turned on and snapshot button does not work.
customer_reviews.author: Charles T. Ferguson

customer_reviews.title: Great little camera!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this camera solely for discovering coin errors. It does the job and them some. Resolution can be set as low as 1600 x 1200 which is more than enough for me to spot errors. The only thing I dislike about the settings is that the previous settings you choose can't be saved. That's minor but still a bit annoying.
customer_reviews.author: Anthony

customer_reviews.title: Works as advertised.
customer_reviews.text: Actually, an amazing tool for the money. Pay attention to how you focus for ultra-close-up work or you will think it's broken. Focus to close-up, then continue past (it will blur) then suddenly get sharp again. Close enough to examine one hair. I wish the resolution was a big higher (it's 640x44) but if you make the image on your computer screen big, then take a "screen shot", you can do pretty good in photoshop. I use it for close-ups of antique gun parts and looking at knife edges, etc. You can also take the "head" off the stand and use it free-hand for checking over parts or items. You can also record video.
customer_reviews.author: Roy Huntington

customer_reviews.title: Great little microscope
customer_reviews.text: Neat little gizmo. I bought it as a spare for a 1.3MP Celestron USB microscope. The resolution is higher, the bendable stand with suction cup is more practical than the Celestron's, they include a convenient plastic plate to put samples on, and the LED illumination is dimmable (or can be turned off). Magnification is also higher (with correspondingly narrower depth of field). Obviously at this price and size the optics are simplified, don't expect Zeiss or Olympus instrument-grade optical clarity. Sharpness is decent enough, it's mostly in the form of color fringing and chromatic aberrations. It's perfect for hobby or educational use, and probably many industrial or QC use cases as well.
customer_reviews.author: Fazal Majid

customer_reviews.title: I good buy for the price
customer_reviews.text: Although the the unit is all plastics, apart from the flexible stan, it works well and has clear images. It does have two focussing levels though....one when the head is about an inch or so from the subject, and the second when the clear plastic head is touching the subject. For the second, which is much enlarged, the unit needs to be drastically refocussed, which is understandable. I good buy for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Allan G Christer

customer_reviews.title: Fun
customer_reviews.text: It does exactly what it says it does. The stand/suction cup leaves something to be desired. I got it for occasional soldering and for my kids to bring stuff in from the back yard to look at. It's perfect for my use. The light is sort of weak, but it's hard to get much better for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Adrien

product_meta.title: Plugable USB 2.0 Digital Microscope with Flexible Arm Observation Stand Compatible with Windows, Mac, Linux (2MP, 250x Magnification)
product_meta.description:
Explore the world of detail around you.

Features

The Plugable USB2-MICRO-250X USB microscope provides up to 250x magnification. The microscope is powered via USB bus power alone (500mA), so no extra power adapter is required. Operates like a standard webcam and can be used with the default webcam software included in your computer's operating system (note that some versions of Windows do not include webcam software by default, although many third-party applications are available for download).

Compatibility

Can be used on most computers and tablets supporting USB webcams, including Windows, Mac OS X, Linux, and Android simply by plugging it into a spare USB 2.0 port (OTG cable and app required for Android tablets). Native OSX support using PhotoBooth in 10.5 or above, third party support in older versions.

No iOS Support.
feature_bullets: HOBBY FOCUSED - Useful and fun for students, collectors, testers, and anyone interested in exploring the microscopic world
HIGH DEFINITION - 2.0 Megapixels, up to 250x magnification (Note: Final magnification corresponds to monitor size)
BROAD COMPATIBILITY - Uses a webcam chipset and sensor to support nearly any operating system using standard webcam software. Users with an Oculus Rift may require additional setup
INTEGRATED LIGHTING - LED halo light with brightness adjustment control. Flexible arm stand with observation pad includes graduated marks for easy measurement
2 YEAR WARRANTY - We love our Plugable products, and hope you will too. This product is covered by a 24-month limited warranty as well as Seattle-based email support

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.4 out of 5 stars2,724 ratings4.4 out of 5 stars
